alert.note: Alert for Bartow; Cherokee; Cobb; North Fulton; Paulding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 7:25AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Paulding, southern Cherokee, Cobb, north central Fulton and southeastern Bartow Counties through 800 AM EDT... At 724 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from George Washington Carver St Pk to Yorkville to Buchanan, and moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Marietta, Dallas, Mountain Park, Roswell, Alpharetta, Milton, Kennesaw, Woodstock, Acworth, Powder Springs, Holly Springs, Hiram, Emerson, Braswell, Fair Oaks, Yorkville, Burnt Hickory Ridge, Kellogg Creek, Red Top Mountain State Park and Lost Mountain Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 AM EDT for north central and northwestern Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Bartow; Cherokee; Cobb; North Fulton; Paulding
